description: Comprehensive baseline test scenario library for UI components and screen patterns. Maps Figma design elements to standardized test scenarios covering functional, visual, accessibility, and edge case testing.

button.description: Interactive button element for user actions

functional.title: Button click triggers expected action
functional.description: Verify button performs its intended action when clicked
steps_template: Verify appropriate feedback is shown (if applicable)

functional.title: Disabled button prevents interaction
functional.description: Verify disabled button does not respond to clicks
steps_template: Verify disabled styling is visible (grayed out, reduced opacity)

functional.title: Button shows loading state during async operations
functional.description: Verify button provides feedback during long operations
steps_template: Observe button state immediately after click
Verify loading indicator appears (spinner, text change)
Verify button is disabled during loading
Verify button returns to normal state

visual.title: Button displays hover state
visual.description: Verify visual feedback on mouse hover
steps_template: Verify visual change occurs (color shift, shadow, underline)
Verify button returns to default state

visual.title: Button shows active/pressed state
visual.description: Verify visual feedback when button is pressed
steps_template: Press and hold mouse button on {component_name}
Verify returns to hover or default state

visual.title: Button text is readable and properly sized
visual.description: Verify button text meets readability standards
steps_template: Verify text is not truncated or cut off
Verify font size is at least 14px

accessibility.title: Button is keyboard accessible
accessibility.description: Verify button can be activated via keyboard
steps_template: Verify focus indicator is clearly visible

accessibility.title: Button has accessible name
accessibility.description: Verify button has descriptive label for screen readers
steps_template: Inspect {component_name} with screen reader or dev tools
Verify button has accessible name (text, aria-label, or aria-labelledby)
Verify name clearly describes button purpose
Verify name is not generic like 'Click here' or 'Button'

accessibility.title: Button has sufficient color contrast
accessibility.description: Verify button text meets minimum contrast ratio
steps_template: Measure contrast ratio between button text and background
Verify ratio is at least 4.5:1 for normal text
Verify ratio is at least 3:1 for large text (18pt+)
Test all button states (default, hover, active, focus, disabled)

accessibility.title: Button focus indicator is visible
steps_template: Verify focus indicator appears (outline, border, glow)
Verify indicator has sufficient contrast (3:1 minimum)
Verify indicator is not hidden or barely visible

edge_cases.title: Rapid/double-click prevention
steps_template: Rapidly click {component_name} multiple times in quick succession
Verify no duplicate API calls or submissions
Verify button enters disabled/loading state after first click

edge_cases.title: Button with very long text
edge_cases.description: Verify button handles long text gracefully
steps_template: Test {component_name} with unusually long text label
Verify text wraps or truncates appropriately

edge_cases.title: Button behavior on slow network
edge_cases.description: Verify button provides feedback on delayed responses
steps_template: Verify button remains disabled until response
Verify timeout handling if request takes too long

security.title: Button validates user permissions
steps_template: Attempt to click {component_name} without required permissions
Verify user is prompted to authenticate if needed

additional_tests: Verify touch target is at least 44x44px
Verify clearly distinguishable from static text
Verify Enter key in form triggers submit

common_issues: No loading feedback on async operations
Poor touch target size on mobile (<44px)

test_data_hints: Sample valid input based on field type

functional.title: Maximum length enforcement
steps_template: Attempt to enter text exceeding max length

functional.title: Copy and paste functionality
steps_template: Verify validation runs on pasted text

functional.title: Clear/reset functionality

visual.title: Placeholder text displays correctly

visual.title: Focus state is visually distinct

visual.title: Error state styling is clear

usage_notes.how_to_use: 1. Match Figma components to entries in ui_components using detection_patterns. 2. For each matched component, retrieve applicable test_scenarios. 3. Populate steps_template with actual component names and context. 4. Filter scenarios by priority and tags based on test coverage goals. 5. For detected screen patterns, add pattern-specific scenarios. 6. Generate final test cases by combining component and pattern scenarios.

priority_levels.critical: Must test - core functionality, smoke tests, blocking issues
priority_levels.high: Should test - important features, common user paths
priority_levels.medium: Test if time allows - less critical features, nice-to-haves
priority_levels.low: Optional - edge cases, minor visual details
